articles.title: Scientists uncover microbes that destroy 'forever chemical' pollutants - Livescience.com
articles.description: Little is known about the fate of PFAS in our environment, but new research finds that bacteria in wastewater can degrade specific types of "forever chemicals."
articles.content:
Certain bacteria can degrade the strong bonds that give "forever chemicals" their long shelf life, and this hints at potential low-cost treatments that could cleanse water of concerning PFAS.
